page.title: 14FARMING AT BOURNE END
page.content: We interviewed a farmer at Bourne End who owned two neighbouring farms that had a total area of 190 acres.In addition the farmer rented 90 acres. The farmer and his son worked on the farm and his wife helped out at harvest time.They worked a long day usually from 8 a.m.to 8 p.m. seven days a week and had little spare time. Although it is a mixed farm the main concern is rearing 160 beef cattle.In addition 6 breeding sows and their litters are raised,and also a few cows for calf rearing. Spring sown barley is grown on 85 acres,while the rest is permanent pasture.The oats and some barley are used as cattle feed.The rest is sold for cattle feed and malting. The crops are sown by combine drill which sows the grain and an artificial manure at the same time.
